website_summaries.verdict: A top-selling scientific calculator by Texas Instruments that is a handy educational tool for students in introductory algebra and beyond.
pros: A popular calculator ideal for numerous math and science applications, including chemistry, biology, statistics, and algebra
Has a spacious screen, pull-down menu, and pre-loaded apps
cons: Learning how it works can be confusing, but the company provides access to web tutorials to help you

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Calculator for Geometry
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the TI-84 for my daughter to use in her 10th grade Geometry class. The course required the TI-84. I asked her how she likes it and she says, "it works well, it's fast, not heavy and doesn't slip on her desk." This is the 3rd TI calculator I've purchased and overall I've been satisfied with their products. We use rechargeable batteries so I'm not concerned that it takes AAA batteries versus a rechargeable battery that comes with the TI-84 Plus CE.
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota2k4

customer_reviews.title: Worst than one star
customer_reviews.text: Beyond disappointed with this purchase. Calculator was extremely dirty, buttons worn off and calculator was all written on. No backing on calculator or batteries provided. Advertised as “lightly used” — This was not that. Returned right away and will not be reordering ever again. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M

customer_reviews.title: Works well...but no quality control???
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the calculator works and is in good condition. However, it arrived with notes scrawled all over the case in pencil, an odd gouge on one side, and it wasn’t factory reset! While all of these problems are fixable, it shows a lack of quality control. Other buyers might not be so lucky-buyer beware! At least the notes are useful...
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Great classic calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is a great classic TI calculator. I had the same one years ago in high school and I remember it just the same. The design is good, with buttons clearly labeled and accessible. There are so many functions of use for the 84-plus, and I am still discovering more every day. The reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is because I find at times the display is difficult to read while graphing. I knew there was a color edition which has a much nicer display, but the $60 price difference convinced me this one would be sufficent and it is. I recommend the 84-Plus for everyday graphing calculator needs.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but way overpriced for screen quality and speed. Tech from 20 yrs ago.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. But really, in this day and age, the screen is outdated and the speed is too slow for this price. Think about comparable devices available at this price - way more advanced than this. Basically the same technology used 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Looking for Quality Items

customer_reviews.title: Dont purchase from this seller
customer_reviews.text: Looked new when it arrived. All functions worked except the enter button so its basically not usable since you cannot get an answer. Seller is claiming it worked properly before they sold it.
customer_reviews.author: KSF

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy reliable programmable. It will take you to calculus and beyond.
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy work with Calculator that will take me from basic algebra to calculus. It is programmable. Are use the feature to program it to solve linear equations. That was difficult but fun. I could’ve bought programs for it. But I wanted the experience of doing it myself.In retrospect I would buy the color version of this calculator. But if your price conscious the black-and-white version will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny L Parsons Jr

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t call it “very good condition “
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not in “very good” condition like I expected. Front plate is cracked in a few spots and pretty scratched up. My daughter started using it tonight so currently all functions work that have been use. Others are currently TBD as needed. I would probably list this as decent or fair possibly good if all ends up working correctly. It isn’t bad, but definitely not worth the money I paid for a “very good” condition calculator.
customer_reviews.author: amanda wenger

customer_reviews.title: Great for Standardized testing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an 8th grade AP math supply list. Our daughter has not even used it for class yet and says she likes it. This is a great calculator that can be used from Middle school AP classes, to College level Math classes. This is one of the few approved calculators to be allowed for Standardized testing, that's why I bought it. I was going to purchase the software app version of this for an Android phone until I realized it would be a better investment to purchase this for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Very bad condition
customer_reviews.text: I knew this was used when I bought this but it was in terrible shape. It was very dirty, didn't have a charger, and no instructions. I was able to use a charger I had from something else and it does power on. I can go online and find a manual I'm sure I just haven't yet. It doesn't hold a charge and it could be because it's not the right charger or it's just a piece of crap. Either way I didn't spend much so it's a learning experience for me but be wary of buying used products.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best Calculator Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best calculator ever! Had a TI-nspire for two years and just couldn't figure out how to work the damn thing. Downgraded to this cheaper and more user friendly model. Still use it every now and then as I'm finishing up college. My sister has an identical one.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Authentic TI84 Plus, very happy with my purchase. Works perfectly, daughter uses it daily and loves it. Would buy again. EDIT: I see that reviews for "New" and "Used" are lumped together. I bought mine "New", still in the unopened package, and it is perfect. Buying "used" electronics is a crap shoot at best. If you can swing it, buy "NEW" when it comes to any electronics, IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry C.

customer_reviews.title: This company is greedy
customer_reviews.text: It's a good calculator but it's way overpriced. Why are we still paying nearly 100$ for something with outdated hardware? This company keeps these insanely high prices because they have contracts with school districts. Absolutely ridiculous to charge students such a ridiculous price.
customer_reviews.author: Dersie

customer_reviews.title: A dinosaur that schools should replace with far more capable devices
customer_reviews.text: A necessary evil if you have kids in middle/high school. Given that you can purchase an entire Chromebook or tablet with a large screen, support for tens of thousands of apps, Internet access, etc. for little more than twice the price, I find it hard to understand why this one trick pony remains relevant.
customer_reviews.author: Quahog

customer_reviews.title: So far we are pleased
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday and my daughter who is in HS likes it very much! It is brand new and very user friendly. She said it’s even better than the one she uses at school. Need to add that it came with batteries and a cable, very well packed and took only 3 days with free shipping! Also, per my delivery instructions, the Amazon delivery driver hid the package from the porch pirates. Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: When selecting the buy new feature you still get used a calculator with no accessories
customer_reviews.text: The calculator is all that came, no software, no cable, no power cable. This item was sent incomplete and definitely not renewed as the pictures show it's not even clean. I was under the impression that when I paid extra for the "buy new" function on Amazon that I would get a new calculator not a refurbished one. Definitely not what I expected to receive. But at least it arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Fmscion

customer_reviews.title: Calculator dead after only 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: You'd expect this from some kind of cut-rate Chinese knockoff calculator, but not from Texas Instruments at full price. The calculator is dead after only 9 months. If your school bullies you into buying one of these, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyD

customer_reviews.title: The screen is broken
customer_reviews.text: I want to return it the screen is breaking up and its only May 2019. Purchase date was January 2019. Its not clear towards the bottom when I am entering in information. Technical issue for sure.
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: Great and does what it needs to do
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing calculator. It does everything it needs to do for algebra (what I took this year). I have had this for two years and have dropped it several times. Nothing is wrong with this calculator after dropping it. My calculator lasted for 2 years on the first batteries I put in. The only con is when graphing it takes a while to load while the others in my class are already finished. Overal this is a great calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Spartysenior

customer_reviews.title: NOT Like New - No guidebook
customer_reviews.text: This item was sold as "Like New" but it isn't. It shows signs of heavy use on the exterior. The cover seems to be new and even has the static plastic covering to peel off. A guidebook was not included as was indicated in the description. Will need to do further testing to make sure it is properly loaded and working as the manufacturer intended.
customer_reviews.author: TheSergeant

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: This calculator worked for a couple of months and then it died. It won’t power up anymore. I emailed the manufacturer and they said to clean the IO port and blow some air into it. No good. Dead.
customer_reviews.author: Markos

customer_reviews.title: My son needed a graphing calculator
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a graphing calculator, this specific one, for his sophomore high school algebra class. Seems to work well, has a nice hard shell with an instruction booklet. We got the warranty on it, just in case! Whatever happened to graphing using graphing paper? lol. No issues to date. I had a Texas Instrument graphing calculator in high school, an older version, of course, but that thing lasted for over 10 years. I'm hoping that things haven't changed much as far as hardiness, construction, and quality and that this one will last a long time as well.
customer_reviews.author: justbeingjulz

customer_reviews.title: Pointlessly Elaborate - Yet Required By Schools, so there you go.
customer_reviews.text: Schools are still requiring that kids get these pointlessly elaborate calculators - so I had to shell out $100 (or the price of a 7" Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 Lite) for one. I'm sure in the right hands this device can be extremely powerful - however in 20+ years of doing engineering and a variety of other technical jobs I have never used one, and have never seen one used (outside of a classroom). They make lousy calculators (for doing arithmetic and other basic mathematical functions), so the vast majority of the untold number of devices sold are guaranteed to be sitting in the bottom of a drawer somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Childs

customer_reviews.title: Massive difference in math confidence
customer_reviews.text: My daughter came to love math after getting her her own calculator. The school options were broken and always had kids fitting for the better calculators. She gets the math better because she can work on the problems at home without the school equipment. Massive difference in her confidence
customer_reviews.author: 75oreo

customer_reviews.title: Good Condition
customer_reviews.text: Sold by The Calculator Cabana, this calculator came in good condition and as pictured (seller was very upfront and showed imperfections on the calculator in pictures without trying to hide it) My only feedback was that it could have been cleaned thoroughly before shipping. It had debris in the small indented lines on the back of the cover and calculator, but it wasn’t anything I couldn’t clean myself.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M.

customer_reviews.title: An upgraded calculator
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughter who is in high school. I was bothered by the price alone but Amazon had it cheaper. My daughter explained to me--it was an absolute "must have" and because she's a straight A student, I try to oblige all of her needs. Product works great!
customer_reviews.author: Pebblesloc

customer_reviews.title: Nice Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I used this calculator for a statics class. Class was hard and the calculator made it somewhat easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine S.

customer_reviews.title: This is a good calculator.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great calculator and is capable of a lot. It’s a Ti so quality is expected. I used this calculator for years and it still works. The only reason I don’t use it now is because it can’t evaluate expressions with complex coefficients which, unfortunately, is a must for Signals and systems many other electrical engineering classes.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Family

customer_reviews.title: A must for school now.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my youngest daughter as this is a must for any advanced schooling now. At the time this was the one to buy and it has worked flawless till this day. It does what you need and is recommended by our advanced school programs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: The most amazing calculator I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing calculator I have ever owned. It was perfect for checking my homework, but was not allowed on tests. Did anything and everything, including graphing. I left it in a class, and when I went back, it had been taken.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Quality Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator September 8, 2016 from the seller OceansideComputers. I have to take a lot of math classes as a computer science major, and so far this calculator has been holding up perfectly for me. I haven't even changed the batteries since I've bought it. I would recommend this calculator. My only complaint is how hard it is to read the screen in low lighting, but that's expected with the kind of display this product uses.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Cortez Jr

customer_reviews.title: pleased with our purchase - easy to use and intuitive
customer_reviews.text: My high schooler (Calculus AB) found it easy to use and intuitive. This is the first graphing calculator we have purchased after reading many reviews. We are pleased with our purchase quality and also the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Calculator Runs Decently
customer_reviews.text: The calculator works as expected: it runs smoothly, calculates at a fairly fast pace, and doesn't seem to freeze up or glitch out at the moment. I'm not exactly used to using graphing calculators, so it's pretty difficult to use for me (to no fault of the calculator).
customer_reviews.author: NezoGoku

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and I had no problems at all. I had it for about a year and a half or more with the batteries it came with and just now a month ago did I have to replace them. They batteries last long and it was in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Edina D.

customer_reviews.title: A great calculator - durable and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is an awesome piece of technology. If you need a graphing calculator, you can't go wrong with this one. It is remarkably sturdy, having survived a couple falls without incident. I can't compare it to others, like other reviewers, but I can tell you that it worked fine for a college-level Calculus course and was recommended by the professor. If you have a kid in high school, buy this one and it should last them through college.
customer_reviews.author: Paddywhack

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: How do you even review a calculator I only used it for math one was a basic intro to math the other was stats 125 anyways it works great no glitches batteries good screen and buttons work everything is alright with it and whoever needs a calculator for a long time I recommend the ti84 since most professors ask for it.
customer_reviews.author: Dina Dzafic

customer_reviews.title: From the trash?
customer_reviews.text: I’m so shocked and disappointed with the condition that this product arrived in!! It looks awful and as if it was dug up from garbage to be sent out to me. I ordered this as a new product and it costs over $100. Ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Fergerson

customer_reviews.title: Just what the teacher asked us to get!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this calculator for my husband for college classes. This was exactly what his teachers wanted him to get. It is expensive, but this calculator can be used through all the math courses he'll be taking. That's about 4 years of school! So in my opinion, it's well worth it. There is a lot that you can do with this calculator. It comes with a manual, and my husbands teacher did a video on how to use it. If yours doesn't do this, there are a lot of YouTube videos on how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: BillyJo

customer_reviews.title: Expected quality-great price!
customer_reviews.text: I actually had this delivered to my son in college. He couldn’t find a graphing calculator for this price! I was so excited when I found exactly what I wanted for an extremely decent price. Package took 3 days to get to him and worked perfectly when he opened it. Expected quality for a Texas Instrument calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Dependable & Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this calculator since AP Statistics in high school and it has carried me through the entirety of college. It's my favorite piece of technology and I will be a little sad the day I stop using it for classes. Best buy and dependability on the market now!
customer_reviews.author: Delaine Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My daughters school uses these. Says it very easy. She swore I had to but one. Could have rented one. Good news she can use it for college next. Does everything she needs in her calculas class
customer_reviews.author: floresfamilynic

customer_reviews.title: The worst product ever made
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is so useless people mostly use it for cheating on exams, a casio fx900 is so much better and easier
customer_reviews.author: Abdulfattah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this calculator a year early for our daughter, due to changing courses at the last minute. So it sat in a closet on a shelf for 1 year and we got it out and it's completely dead. Changed batteries, tried factory reset, looked online for a fix and nothing works. Now its too late and they won't let us exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Serina P. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it’s better to spend a few dollars more for a new one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item used, but had to return it. I returned the calculator because it didn’t come with the manual and it looked like it was missing a part. Although, the calculator was in very good condition.
customer_reviews.author: CMBT MDC

customer_reviews.title: Clearing the RAM can be frustrating
customer_reviews.text: It's a great calculator. I used to have a Casio graphing calculator that had more features than this, however I find this calculator easier to program. The RAM is non-volatile, which means the applications you install into RAM will be saved until cleared. The command combination of "SHIFT + 7 1 2" erases the RAM, and all installed programs on it. Erasing the RAM is necessary at times to revert everything to default. I don't like the idea that both the settings and programs are installed in non-volatile RAM. But hey, who am I to complain? Its drawbacks aren't too problematic for me. I like this calculator, overall.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Glass

customer_reviews.title: Way too complicated!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is very complicated and the fact that a users manual is not included when you purchase it is VERY frustrating. I had to purchase this for a statistics class but i have no clue what more than half of the functions do or mean. I still haven't figured out to solve some of my stat problems using this calculator. I have to do them in two or three steps using a regular calculator, which is really annoying when you consider how much this calculator costs.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi R

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Holds up in a teenagers back pack.
customer_reviews.text: This was a requirement for my sons math class. He has had no problem. Does everything he needs it to. It has taken a beating in his backpack and still works. The screen is easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: V. Peel

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my STAT 145 (elementary statistics) class and it works just as expected. It's really hard to go wrong with Texas Instruments, they set the standard for graphing calculators. The batteries that come with it aren't stellar, and it needs 4 AAAs, I believe, so you might want to get better batteries for when your calculator runs out of juice.
customer_reviews.author: Femme

customer_reviews.title: won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: This calculator was wonderful. Then five months after purchase, it stopped turning on! We charged it - nothing. Purchased new batteries - nothing! My square space coverage says it should be covered under manufacturer warranty, but amazon says it is closed. I hate to think i am out 130+ dollars before one school year is even over! Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Goodyke

customer_reviews.title: a cheaper calc. is so much easier.
customer_reviews.text: You can get a much better calculator that is much easier to use for a lot cheaper. I bought this because it was required for a math class and I am very disappointed. I bought a Casio fx-115es plus (not a graphing calc.) for 12 dollars and it is so much easier to use! The Casio is much easier to input data properly (mainly complex fractions and algebraic expressions.) only get this calc. if it is required, and see if you cant get buy with a newer version.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Not the same color I thought I was getting
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered mine and I didn’t know it was going to be yellow. The picture showed the black calculator with a black case and everything, and the description said it would be black. When I opened the package, it was a yellow calculator. It works just fine, and I actually loveeee the yellow color, but it just surprised me and I want everyone else to make sure they get theirs in the right color.
customer_reviews.author: Kira McArthur

customer_reviews.title: WOW.. expensive but necessary.
customer_reviews.text: WOW.. 100 bucks for a calculator.. well, if you have someone who does some serious math, then this is probably the required model. Seems to do everything my kid needs it to do. I'd give it more stars if it were more cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Drue

customer_reviews.title: A good calculator
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed this calculator for school but was difficult to find in store. Truthfully, she chose this particular one because it's the one she knows how to use. ;) Works well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!!  Worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product!! Just received today!! Both calculators appear to work. The post office had to put protective plastic wrap on it since the packaging they originally came in was very damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Cecce

customer_reviews.title: Never have to upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My daughter tells my it was worth every penny, she’s had it for years now in school and never tells me she’s needs an upgrade (she’s in the engineering stem classes at high school)
customer_reviews.author: jason bailey

customer_reviews.title: Helps with School
customer_reviews.text: This calculator does the trick. My son needs it for school and he seems to like it. I believe it does graphing as well which is something amazing for a calculator to do. No issues to report
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Investment
customer_reviews.text: Much to my chagrin, son's AP classes required purchase of a graphics calculator. He is unusually hard on his tech tools/phone/computer, etc. but I find that if I invest in the best ones they last longer. This seems to be the case this calculator. He has kept it with him and even with being thrown around in backpack, etc. it is doing exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: katyq02

customer_reviews.title: Used - Very Good - with new 4 batteries
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last summer. Condition: Used - Very Good - with new 4 batteries. Works great! The old model works just as well as the new one, just not with a digital screen. Used for 2 months in the summer, 3 months for another quarter, and currently using it. Shipped quickly. Item as described.
customer_reviews.author: diana!

customer_reviews.title: This really is a great product for students who have higher math
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it!! This really is a great product for students who have higher math. The price was great because in stores it cost way more for the same item. Also it was shipped early and there is a case here in Amazon that fits everything for the calculator, wires, flash drives. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Christine Blankert

customer_reviews.title: can't see the screen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for my son. He didn't tell me till a month later that from start he hardly could see the screen. I just checked, it's so deem, that you have to look at the screen from other angles to be able to see anything. I wish we could return it and get a better quality calculator but' it has been more than 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Olga K.

customer_reviews.title: The Volvo of Calculators
customer_reviews.text: This is a requirement for my daughter's high school math classes and she really enjoys using this unit. It's easy to use, easy to understand, and has all the bells and whistles that are needed. It's not the Mercedes of calculators, but I'd be comfortable saying it's a higher end Volvo.
customer_reviews.author: Uhapi Beauty

customer_reviews.title: It’s a graphing calculator.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a graphing calculator for school applications and it does the job. I’m not thrilled about the screen quality. I’ve had other TI calculators that are easier to see. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: My high school kid's math teacher require this for class so I bought it and as long as it works I am fine with it
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about it. My high school kid's math teacher require this for class so I bought it and as long as it works I am fine with it. Only gripe is that in my humble opinion calculator with small, low resolution black and white screen and a fraction of processing power of today's phones, music players, tablets etc can"t really cost 100 bucks. But with no competition and strict school requirements we do not have a lot of choice, do we?
customer_reviews.author: soul guy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic calculator
customer_reviews.text: Great easy purchase. Easy to use. My son was happy. Screen was clear and easy to read. He enjoys using it and his grade is wonderful so he and it must be doing something right😂😉
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA D

customer_reviews.title: Best Calculator for the Job
customer_reviews.text: My favorite calculator. I had to replace mine since I have moved several times and lost it in the process. I've used this calculator for nearly 10 yrs and it's still my favorite. Everything is easy to understand and edit. Never will I live without it again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this a couple of months ago for my daughter at college. It has already quit working. We replaced the battery and it’s still not working. $100 wasted. We missed the return window by a few weeks. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee & a Book

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, fast service
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't completely sure about buying from this seller because he only had a few reviews which were all 5 stars. I could've bought from other sellers (with a lot of good reviews) who were selling the same product but were more expensive. I decided to give this seller a try. I got the product in 3 or 4 days. It was in great condition (looks brand new) and worked great! I would definitely buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is reliable and usually fast. It has the clear graphing component that's easy to read and compare more than one type of graph. It has built in functions that I've used for Statistics, Calculus, and even some functions used in a Physics class. It has more built-in functions than a TI-83, the face and display is also an upgrade from the 83. It's quite large for smaller hands, but still fits within a grip. Batteries are easy to access and replace, and battery life is exceptionally long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's the standard calculator. Should be about 1/5th the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's the standard calculator. Should be about 1/5th the price by now, but it costs a lot since they have the design standard and nobody can copy it?
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherGuyBuyinStuff

customer_reviews.title: Very dirty and scratched!
customer_reviews.text: No where does it say someone else's name would be carves in the calculator and I paid good money for this! It was scratch and dirty as well. Very disappointed and embarrassed thinking I was giving my son a new calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Great Price For a Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This brand new calculator was bought for a college course I am taking. The packaging is brand new. It comes with batteries, a USB port, and easy to read instructions on how to use the primary functions. The buttons are easy to press, the calculator has a long lifespan, and the resolution on the screen is fantastic. This was a worthwhile buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnee Makin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for my son's math class the screen and buttons are in perfect shape everything works exactly as it should. There was some paint on the case but it in no way affected use of the calculator it was a great purchase and it came 3 days early!
customer_reviews.author: Tilly

customer_reviews.title: Thank You.
customer_reviews.text: I was taking Math-150 two semesters ago and let me tell everyone how helpful this baby was and easy it was to use. I got a B in the class and let me tell you I suck at math but I manage to get through it and this baby did it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Necessary Evil
customer_reviews.text: Texas Instruments has the market on this item due to state test requirements. This model is best option due to cost, newer ones may have a few more options but not worth the price difference. Much practice is needed to get hang of functions, not a very user friendly item. Overall a decent value by this vendor for this item.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: A must own industry standard.
customer_reviews.text: Texas Instrument and Hewlett Packard have done the world a great service over these last 40 years. Though I prefer HP, Texas Instrument is the industry standard and a great value. I own 8 Texas Instrument calculators and have never had any regrets. The TI-84 Plus is a must own product for people wanting an industry standard. I own 2 of them and I've never had any regrets about texas instrument products.
customer_reviews.author: jeff in new england

customer_reviews.title: This is the model that most high schools around my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the model that most high schools around my area are using for the common core algebra. All I can say is that it serves it's purpose. For most people I don't think it is a simple thing to learn to use. It is unfortunate that students must buy and learn to use one of these when you would never use one in real life for anything. You can do the same things on an excel spreadsheet or with any number of apps and programs much easier. If you don't have access to any other type of device, however, this will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered as a replacement so the user was already familiar with the interface and usability. Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: open box
customer_reviews.text: The box came open i thought it's just packaging, things get shuffled but the calculator doesn't function like it should. Too bad I realized it midway through the semester. Can I get a refund for my college tuition I wasted by trusting your product?
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: User friendly, needed for math classes
customer_reviews.text: Bought in college and still have today, useful for calculating bills now but more useful in school. Only wish it was cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Amber Britton

customer_reviews.title: Standard overpriced calculator.
customer_reviews.text: This device is required by school and it does exactly what they expect it to. My only issue is the price vs quality. I get that a lot of the cost goes into special programs that TI funds for schools, but quite frankly this a product that should only cost about 10 dollars. It hasn't changed since I was in high school 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: I could probably find a way to remove it better, but it doesn't bother me enough to try ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as in the description, there is a little writing on the back of it and on the inside of the battery cover. I could probably find a way to remove it better, but it doesn't bother me enough to try to. I put batteries in it and it work fine. I noticed that some of the apps I have seen on other TI-84s I have used are not on this one. However I'm not sure that I will need them. If I do, I can buy a cord and figure out how to put them on there. Also, the product came on time, perhaps a day or two early.
customer_reviews.author: Cari

customer_reviews.title: Large and Built Strong.
customer_reviews.text: You will have to learn how to use. It's very durable and big buttons make it easy to read. I'm looking forward to having this for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bell

customer_reviews.title: STRAIGHT A'S !
customer_reviews.text: BEST PURCHASE MADE...WELL WORTH THE MONEY...HAS HELPED MY DAUGHTER IMMENSELY IN HER ALGEBRA CLASS THIS YEAR! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Girlygirl

customer_reviews.title: I think this is one of the best calculators (both graphing and non-graphing) out there
customer_reviews.text: I think this is one of the best calculators (both graphing and non-graphing) out there. I haven't had any problems with mine, and once you get the hang of how to use it, I think it is pretty simple and very useful, especially in high school and college level math classes. It even makes writing out simple math equations much easier than a non-graphing calculator. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: No charger??
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for my daughters who are both in high school. I knew they didn't come with batteries, but the description said they would come with a charging cable. Low and behold, no charging cable in sight...
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Anna

customer_reviews.title: Better than the TI-83
customer_reviews.text: I had originally purchased the TI-83 for an advanced algebra class, but was disappointed in the operation of some of the features. (I have detailed those in my review of the TI-83.) The TI-84 is exactly what I needed--the display is clearer to follow due to the usage of modified symbols and text sizes, and the scrollback feature to grab prior results or formulas is a must-have. For the little extra it costs to get the TI-84, do it! The TI-83 was fine in its day, but the added functionality of the TI-84 will make using the calculator much easier.
customer_reviews.author: -=Rudy=-Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly useful
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is useful for any kind of math class. From high school to college, you will need a TI-84 or something stronger. Mine arrived on time, but with obvious wear. I don't mind the damage because the calculator works just fine. No buttons are missing and the screen is perfectly fine. There were some scrapes to the side of the calculator though and numbers carved on the back. Overall though, it is a useful calculator that you will surely need sometime in your educational career, and the wear was not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: It was great price for the need, we had one previously and it lasted through high school and college for my older child and we bought this one to replace it after the younger child used for 3 years too.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Mott

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator for middle school and high school
customer_reviews.text: My son has used ths calculator happily for several years since middle school, and recently I bought the same for my daughter who just started middle school. It is simply a great calulator, recommended by his teachers, simple to operate, and offering all the required functions. No complaints at all. This is a coveted calculator at school. After my son's first one was stolen from his desk at school, I learned to use an awl to etch my children's names on all three parts of calculator: the body of the calculator, the detachable cover, and the battery-compartment cover. You can't go wrong with this classic.
customer_reviews.author: Browniebaker

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for school!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good calculator, up to date for use in school if you're looking for one for a student for math courses. Thanks for a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Toms

customer_reviews.title: Damage calculator screen and now more behind in college class.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is damage and that is the way I got it. It wasnt in a box and it was in a bubble bag. To me it should of been package better. So it wouldn't be damage at all. Now I have no calculator and behind in my college courses more now. Because of this damage calculator. I say it look very nice to use and easy to learn. If it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Missie

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper and a must if you are in college
customer_reviews.text: Best calculator I’ve had so far. I use it for college and it has been super helpful. I swear I think I wouldn’t have passed some classes without the calculator. If you are in college and your math class requires it, buy it because you going to fail. Plus, the calculator is cheaper here then some of the bookstores in colleges.
customer_reviews.author: Savid Angola

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great for college. It’s kinda hard to understand at first but once you get a hang of it it’s great to use. Also I’ve dropped this many times and it hasn’t got a scratch on it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: The good ol' TI-84 Plus graphing calculator that is familiar from ...
customer_reviews.text: The described item is exactly what you get. The good ol' TI-84 Plus graphing calculator that is familiar from high school. This calculator is capable of so much. I found a program to find the quadratic formula faster than actually trying to work it out yourself. Of course, I only use it to check my work, since I'm known to switch signs around without realizing it. If you are going through college, I would definitely recommend this item because it is so useful!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for high school math class
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is learning algebra 2 this semester. He said it met his needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia D

customer_reviews.title: Great device for college
customer_reviews.text: May take some time to become familiar with, especially for 1st time users, but overall a great device.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Best price on a TI 84
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for any high school student or beyond. The TI 84+ is required at my school.
customer_reviews.author: yellowapron

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality, a requirement in our high school. Bought 3 so far, the first has just gone off to college with my nephew and still works great. Batteries last a good long time, so that won't bankrupt you. The TI-84 plus Silver is rechargeable, which I do not trust. Those rechargeable battery in things like this I do not trust. The software can be downloaded free of charge from the TI website to match the silver.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is perfect for graphing, equations, and everything else you can think of (yes, programming too). Got this for my college algebra class in order to graph. This calculator is the only advanced one I've seen by TI that isn't normally banned from classrooms. Anyways,I have to dock a star simply because of no manual or guide on how to use any of its functions. Google is your friend though, so not too much trouble will be had. Got one used, so it obviously had some wear on it. Great calculator nonetheless and it'll last you for years.
customer_reviews.author: Chripallo

customer_reviews.title: When the Seller found out I had a problem, they contacted ME to make things right!
customer_reviews.text: I was so surprised when this Seller contacted me about a review I had posted. I seems they were never aware I had requested to return the product through the Amazon website and when they did, they made good on the request and took the calculator back. There was nothing wrong with the item, it was just that I was informed I needed it for an Algebra class, but then it was never necessary. It was a waste of my money, but this company made it right. I would never hesitate to purchase from them again! Thank you for great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: You Asked...so here I go.

product_meta.title: Texas Instruments TI-84 Plus Graphics Calculator, Black
product_meta.description:
The all-purpose TI-84 Plus graphing calculator, ideal for math and science, features more than a dozen preloaded apps including functionality that encourages exploration of interactive geometry, inequality graphing, and real-world data collection and analysis. Ideal for middle school through college.

What's in the Box: 
TI-84 Plus calculator, impact-resistant protective slide case, TI connectivity/USB cable, silver oxide battery, four AAA batteries, Guidebook and free software Apps, warranty information. 
TI-Rechargeable battery

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description Building on the hugely popular TI-83 Plus, which is perhaps the best-selling calculator of all time, the TI-84 Plus is completely compatible with its predecessor. From that well-established platform, this new model adds more speed (a processor that's 2.5 times faster), more memory (24 KB RAM and 480 KB of Flash ROM), an enhanced high-contrast display (eight lines by 16 characters), and more beloved Apps. 

 

Includes a USB Port and cable. It also adds USB on-the-go technology (cable included) that can be used to share files with other calculators or to connect to PCs or optional presentation tools.

 

Comes with 12 pre-loaded Apps and supports all TI-83 Apps. Twelve Apps are pre-loaded, including Cabri Jr., CBL/CBR, Conic Graphing, Inequality Graphing, Probability Simulations, Science Tools, StudyCards, TimeSpan, Topics in Algebra 1 Chapter 5, Topics in Algebra 1 Chapters 1-4, Transformation Graphing, and more. For students in math and sciences, the TI-84 Plus is a powerful, problem-solving tool with features for storing, graphing, and analyzing up to 10 functions. Plus, it displays graphs and evaluates tables on a split screen, allowing you to trace the graph and scroll through table values simultaneously.

 

Split screen lets you view a graph and its equation at the same time. With the TI-84 Plus, you can view an equation, its graph, and the coordinates all at one time. Jump from point to point by entering a number. Several useful plot types are available, including scatter, box-and-whisker, XY-line, histogram, and normal probability plots. Advanced statistics and regression analysis, graphical analysis, and data analysis are readily accessed, along with features for calculus, engineering, financial, logarithm, trigonometry, and hyperbolic functions--all crucial tools for advanced analysis. With its clear display and fast processing, the calculator incorporates graphing tools for mathematics and science course work, including statistics and finance.

 

The included normal slide case is great for desktop work. The TI-84 Plus is powered by four AAA alkaline batteries (not included) and one silver oxide battery (included) for backup, with an automatic shutoff to save energy. It also comes with a hard normal slide case and is supported by a one-year limited warranty.

What's in the Box
TI-84 Plus, normal slide case, TI connectivity cable/USB cable, silver oxide battery, TI Product CD-ROM with full reference Guidebook and free software Apps, warranty information; four AAA batteries not included, alkaline recommended
feature_bullets: Preloaded with software, including Cabri Jr. interactive geometry software.
Up to ten graphing functions defined, saved, graphed and analyzed at one time.
Advanced functions accessed through pull-down display menus.
Horizontal and vertical split screen options. Vibrant backlit color screen
I/o port for communication with other TI products.Seven different graph styles for differentiating the look of each graph drawn

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,569 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
